holes.desc: Opening par 5 that rewards a confident tee ball and smart placement on your second. Play to your number and take advantage of an early birdie look.
A solid par 4 where position off the tee sets up everything. Favor the fairway and you’ll have a clean approach into the green.
A strong par 4 that asks for accuracy and commitment. Stay in play and you can attack the green—miss the fairway and it turns into a grind.
Short par 3 where distance control matters more than power. Aim center-green and take par when the pin is tucked.
A longer par 5 that plays as a true three-shot hole for many. Smart layups and wedge control are the path to birdie chances.
A mid-length par 4 that rewards a controlled tee shot into the fairway. Play the approach to the safe side and let putting do the work.
A short par 3 that’s gettable if you pick the right club. Avoid getting too aggressive—misses can leave a delicate recovery.
A playable par 4 where a good drive leaves wedge or short iron. Respect the green’s subtle slopes and stay below the hole when possible.
A strong closing par 4 on the front with an approach that demands the right number. Commit to your target and take par into the turn.
Back-nine opener that rewards a confident tee shot and a committed line into the green. A great hole to build momentum.
A steady par 4 where staying in the fairway makes scoring realistic. Favor the middle of the green and let the putter work.
A mid-iron par 3 that plays differently with the wind. Pick a smart target and aim for the heart of the green.
A demanding par 5 that rewards smart decisions more than hero shots. A well-placed second sets up a great wedge look.
A strong par 4 where position off the tee matters. Choose a conservative line if needed and trust a solid approach.
Short par 3 that’s a great chance to score if your distance is right. Misses can leave touchy chips, so aim center-green.
A long par 5 coming in—play it in steps and don’t force it. A smart layup sets up the best birdie chances.
A tough par 4 late in the round where accuracy is everything. Take a controlled tee shot and commit to your approach number.
A strong finishing par 4 back toward the clubhouse. Keep it in play off the tee and finish with one committed swing into the green.
